Key Match Events: Bobby Witt Jr. drove in the go-ahead run with an infield single in the sixth inning, securing the Royals' victory over the Orioles in Game 2 of the Wild Card Series.
Pre-Game Insights: The Royals advanced to the ALDS with a 2-game sweep of the Orioles, defeating them 2-1 in the second game.
Post-Match Reflections: The Orioles were swept in their playoff series for the second consecutive year, ending their postseason hopes.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Royals left 12 runners on base and relied on their bullpen to secure the narrow victory.
Others: The game marked the Royals' successful advancement to the ALDS, setting up a potential matchup with the New York Yankees.
